metadata.title: CVE-2019-5841 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Out of bounds memory access in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to75.0.3770.80 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.142-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
